content.raw:
I tried to test this but I could not detect a difference with and without the PR:  
When restarting Blacs there are no Icon-problems.  
However when starting Blacs from console it never has the right icon; I tried on different windows PC’s. Looking into the code I was wondering why the function `def set_win_appusermodel(window_id):` expects an argument to be passed but when calling the function in line 426 there is no argument passed:

    # Connect the windows AppId stuff:
            if os.name == 'nt':
                self.ui.newWindow.connect(set_win_appusermodel)

Is this maybe the reason that it has no effect?
content.html:
I tried to test this but I could not detect a difference with and without the PR:
When restarting Blacs there are no Icon-problems.
However when starting Blacs from console it never has the right icon; I tried on different windows PC’s. Looking into the code I was wondering why the function def set_win_appusermodel(window_id): expects an argument to be passed but when calling the function in line 426 there is no argument passed:

# Connect the windows AppId stuff:
        if os.name == 'nt':
            self.ui.newWindow.connect(set_win_appusermodel)

Is this maybe the reason that it has no effect?
